1. Cereals, grains, and tubers (including wheat bread, pasta, rice, couscous, potatoes, etc.)
2. Legumes and nuts (including beans, chickpeas, peas, nuts, etc.)
3. Milk and dairy products (including milk, cheese, sour cream, yoghurt, etc.)
4. Eggs, meat, fish (including beef, chicken, lamb, canned fish, fresh fish, etc.)
5. Vegetables and leaves (including onions, lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, red peppers, spinach, etc.)
6. Fruits (including bananas, apples, cherries, dates, lemons, apricots, pears, etc.)
7. Oil and fat (including vegetable oil, butter, margarine, lard, etc.)
8. Sugar and sweets (including sugar, honey, jam, cakes, cookies, sweets, sugary drinks, etc.)
9. Condiments and spices (including garlic, tomato paste, and small quantities of items from other food groups)

Do not have the appropriate documents

Forced eviction, i.e. from armed group pressure or land-grabbing
Clearance of camp/public space by authorities
No documentation to prove legal ownership

Request to vacate from owner of buidling/land

I buy for my household (family members or dependents)

Driven there by somebody I know

Protected well (e.g., in your house or in the mosque)

What kind of toilet do you have access to inside your shelter or within easy reach?
No toilet inside shelter or within easy reach
How far is the nearest accessible toilet from your dwelling?
How did you most often dispose of trash over the past 30 days?
Collected by the municipality, waste management service (private or public), or other authority
Put in a public place designated for waste disposal, to be collected later
Left in the road or in a public place not designated for waste disposal
How far is the trash disposal point from your dwelling?
How frequently is your trash collected?
Less frequently than once per month
Among these products, are there any that you require but are unable to purchase?
There are no hygiene products that we require but are unable to purchase

Have you been ill in the past 15 days?
Did you go to a health facility to access the needed health care?
Do you face any challenges accessing health care when you need it?
what are the main reasons for you to have limited or no access to healthcare?
Health facilities have been damaged or destroyed
Distance to health facilities is too far
Route to health facilities is unsafe
No available health facilities that can accept new patients
No/lack of money to pay for care
Lack of means of transport to get to the healthcare facilities
Lack of medical staff in general
Lack of female medical staff in particular
Lack of private room(s) for receiving confidential care
Price barriers to access medical aid
No available health facilities that accept refugees/migrants
Did not know where to go
For females, denial of permission from family members to visit health facility
For females, absence of male companion to accompany during visit to health facility
Afraid to become known as a migrant
What do you do when you do not have enough money to pay for all the healthcare that is needed?
Revert to non-medical alternatives  (e.g., traditional medicine, home treatments)
Get medical treatment from individuals without professional training
Use expired medicine or recycle medical items (e.g., syringes
Travel abroad for required medical treatment
Travel to other manitkas for required medical treatment
Reduce expenditures on other needs (education, NFIs,  food)
Visit health centre managed by NGO
Visit Libyan medical doctor outside medical facilities
Visit foreign medical doctor outside medical facilities,

Have not visited a local health service provider
Driven there by somebody I know

Which diseases do you suffer from?
Do you have adequate access to the needed health care services to treat this condition?
Limited access (only sometimes, limited quantity, etc.)
What are the services that are not available (when needed or prescribed)?
No access to the health facility
Lack of availability of specialized consultation
Lack of availability of general practitioners for the follow-up
Lack of availability of radiologic tests (X-ray, ultrasound, scan, MRI, etc.)
Lack of availability of biologic tests (blood test, urinary test, etc.)
Lack of availability of specialized medical investigation (fibroscopy, angiography, etc.)
Within the past 30 days, have you experienced any of the following? (select all that apply)
I did not experience any of the below
Feeling little interest or pleasure doing things that you normally like
Feeling tired or having little energy for no good reason
Trouble falling asleep, staying asleep or sleeping too much
Felt so nervous that nothing could calm you down
Felt so afraid that nothing could calm you down
Felt so angry that you felt out of control

Do you have physical or cognitive difficulties (for example: mobility, hearing, sight, communicating) which impact your ability to carry out day-to-day activities such as working, studying, walking, getting dressed, and remembering things?
Do you fall into any of the following categories:
Minor difficulties carrying out daily activities but does not need assistance or attention
No difficulty carrying out daily activities
A lot of difficulty carrying out daily activiites and needs quite a bit of assistance and atention (e.g., for 3-6 hours/day)
Some difficulties carrying out daily activities and needs some assistance and attention (e.g., for 1-2 hours/day)
Cannot carry out daily activities independently and needs permanent assistance and attention
What was the cause of the disability?
Mine, unexploded ordnance (UXO), or improvised explosive device (IED)
Pregnancy complications (i.e., complications to the mother)
Do you have adequate access to the health care that you need to treat or manage your condition?
Limited access (only sometimes, limited quantity, etc.)
What are the services that are not available (when needed or prescribed)?
Lack of physical therapy and/or rehabilitation
Lack of other assistive devices (e.g., prosthetic limbs or hearing aids)
What type of education do the children in your household have access to in this baladiya?
Of the school-aged children in your household who are neither enrolled in school nor attending school, why are they not attending school?
Problems with school infrastructure, or school is used for other purpose
Problems with means, transport, materials, or food
Problems with quality, curriculum, or capacity
Problems with child's health or behavior, lack of documentation, child marriage or pregnancy, discrimination, or the need for the child to work at home or for a salary
What are the specific problems around school infrastructure that have contributed to the school-aged children not attending school?
Lack of basic amenities at school (potable water, heat, electricity)
Lack of infrastructure (school buildings or classrooms) to accommodate all children
Lack of latrines separated by sex
Local schools overcrowded/lack of space in local schools
School is used for other purpose
What are the specific problems around means, transport, materials, or food that have contributed to the school-aged children not attending school?
Lack of teaching and learning materials or supplies
What are the specific problems around quality, curriculum, or capacity that have contributed to the school-aged children not attending school?
One or more school level is not available (pre-primary, primary, secondary, tertiary).
Education is not seen as useful
What is taught is not culturally or age appropriate
What are the specific problems around safety and security that have contributed to the school-aged children not attending school?
Insecurity on the way to school or in the area (real or perceived)
The child joined an armed group or military.
Emotional or physical abuse by teachers (corporal punishment, humiliation, corporal punishment etc.)
Emotional or physical abuse by peers (bullying, fighting, discrimination, etc)
What are the specific problems around child vulnerabilities (health/behavior, documentation, etc.) that have contributed to the school-aged children not attending school?
The child has a prolonged illness.
The child has a disability (access issue).
The child is on the move.
Social discrimination (due to ethnicity, religion, poverty, gender, health, disability, or other)
Suspended or expelled for performance or behaviour issues
The child is pregnant, lactating, or has a child of her own.
The child is busy with chores.
Would you like your children in your household that are not attending school to access education while in Libya?
Have any children in your household ever faced any of these issues when attending school in Libya?
No issues faced by children in the household when attending school
Lack of separate and safe toilets for boys and girls
Lack of accessibility for students living with disabilities
Violence from teachers (excluding sexual violence or harassment)
Bullying/violence from other students (excluding sexual violence or harassment)
School building conversion into other purposes (displaced accommodation, military barracks, etc.)

Why do you feel in danger?
I have no one who can help me
I am afraid of or affected by conflict in my area
I am afraid of being robbed
I am afraid of being arrested because of lack of documents
I was previously arrested because lack of documents
I am afraid of being arrested for other reasons (not related to documents)
I was previously arrested for other reasons (not related to documents)
I am afraid of being held captive or detained against my will
I was previously held captive or detained against my will
I am afraid of being kidnapped.
I am afraid of being tortured
I am afraid of being physically harassed (not sexually)
I previously suffered from physical harassment (not sexual)
I previously suffered from verbal harassment
I am afraid of being sexually harassed
I previously suffered from sexual harassment
I am afraid of or affected by enviromental hazards
I am afraid of or affected by mine/ UXO risks
You said that you feel in danger in this baladiya. How do you try to avoid these risks?
There is nothing I can do to avoid the risk
I avoid walking out at night time
I am cautious not to be noticed by strangers
I avoid taking always the same streets/routines
I always carry my belongings/savings with me
I hand my belongings/savings to a friend in Libya
I carry a weapon to defend myself
I stay inside/hidden until the situation improved
I seek protection by a Libyan
I seek protection by other refugees or migrants
What would make you feel safer/less vulnerable to the dangers in Libya?
Having a phone to communicate and ask for help
Having the support of a Libyan person
Knowing other migrants who speak my language

Are girls and boys affected differently by the dangerous situations you mentioned?

I was afraid of being arrested

three to less than six months
one to less than three months
two weeks - less than one month
one week - less than two weeks

Self-help (i.e., cleared the explosive hazard themselves)

Community representative (i.e.m a focal point going around talking to people)
Posters, flyers, or other printed material

Explosive hazard clearance, risk education, or services for survivors
